p: Each experiment period lasted 12 d, which divided into the first 10 d for the rumen dietary adaptation to the treatment and the last 2 d for the sample collection. The sheep were housed in individual pens and fed twice daily at 07:00 and 19:00 h. Corn silage was the forage source and the dietary forage to concentrate ratio was 65.5:34.5. The ingredient composition of the diet ( Table 1) was formulated to meet or exceed the NRC (2007) nutrient requirements of sheep [ 17]. All sheep had ad libitum access to feed and water.
